definition: to be almost within reach/to be close at hand
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
8 in. length unit of Zhou dynasty
a Chinese foot/one-third of a meter/a ruler/a tape-measure/one of the three acupoints for measuring pulse in Chinese medicine/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3]
one of the characters used to represent a musical note in gongche notation, 工尺譜|工尺谱[gong1 che3 pu3]

sentences.english: It smells like summer is right around the corner.
sentences.chinese: 那闻起来像是夏天近在咫尺了。

sentences.english: Chinese Export Commodities Fair Museum in close proximity, 12-storey.
sentences.chinese: 中国出口商品交易会馆近在咫尺，楼高12层。

sentences.english: It is a high-class hotel within a stone's throw distance of Tivoli Park.
sentences.chinese: 与趣伏里公园近在咫尺的高级饭店。

sentences.english: The bridge is still there but this time, it's the way to live.
sentences.chinese: 奈何桥近在咫尺，这次，它是通向生者的桥梁。

sentences.english: The technology already exists, or is within easy reach, they wrote.
sentences.chinese: 他们写道，这项技术已经存在，或者说近在咫尺了。

sentences.english: Kunming Green Lake Park is in the 8-minute distance on foot.
sentences.chinese: 昆明翠湖公园近在咫尺，步行八分钟即可到达。

sentences.english: Metro Line 5 station and the community close the main entrance.
sentences.chinese: 地铁五号线车站与社区正门近在咫尺。

sentences.english: Relying on close proximity to Tianjin sea port, sincerely hope that with you.
sentences.chinese: 海运依托近在咫尺天津港口，真诚地希望与您合作。

sentences.english: It may be near when it seems afar.
sentences.chinese: 它可能近在咫尺，看上去却远在天边。

definition: right under one's nose/right in front of one's eyes/close at hand/imminent
distance apart/separated by a given distance
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
to penetrate/to pierce/to see clearly/to have an insight into
to watch sb closely/to breathe down sb's neck/to mark (sports)
